description: From Latin insidiatus, past participle of insidiare (“to lie in ambush”), from insidiae. See insidious.

verbs.description: insidiate (third-person singular simple present insidiates, present participle insidiating, simple past and past participle insidiated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To lie in ambush for.
examples: he afterwards long sought all advantages how to insidiate his life
